entry.title: Re: Custom Journal Entry Query by G/L and Cost Center in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello @Egorov_Evgeny ,

Thank you for this explanation. It is very clear and helpful!

I am currently working with a similar case and would need some help. I have an existing custom query created in Custom Analytical Queries app and now I want to add another row in the hierarchy of G/L Account like in the screenshots below.

 

I want to have another 'Internal activity allocation prod hours' (debit value; shown in the  'Total Cost of Goods Sold' node and the credit value (with same absolute amount) in the TOE (Total Operation Expenses) node. It should display values for the last column (Amount in company code currency) based on a certain condition. For example: 

In case of G/L account marked as (Debit) HRRP_NODE-BALIND = 'S':

I_ACTUALPLANJRNLENTRYITEMCUBE- CONTROLLINGDEBITCREDITCODE = D, the data from I_ACTUALPLANJRNLENTRYITEMCUBE must only be selected from ACDOCA table, if COSTCENTER = initial.

In case of G/L account marked as (Credit) HRRP_NODE-BALIND = 'H':

I_ACTUALPLANJRNLENTRYITEMCUBE- CONTROLLINGDEBITCREDITCODE = C, the data from I_ACTUALPLANJRNLENTRYITEMCUBE must only be selected from ACDOCA table, if COSTCENTER <> initial.

 

I tried your example with the Structure Element but it creates another row independent of G/L Account or even columns in some adapted cases. I need it inside the specified node.

Could you please support me with that? 

Thanks in advance,

Silvi

entry.title: Re: Where can I get SAP C_TS4FI_2023 Practice Questions 2...
entry.content:
Hello @RachelPatrick , how are you?

I recently took and successfully passed my certification for #SAP ERP CLOUD ERP PRIVATE in Finance (TS4FI).

What I recommend the most is using the quizzes from each LearningHub content section mentioned in the “How to prepare” guide. By completing all of them, you’ll get a very accurate idea of what the actual questions will be like later on.

I’m referring to the following:

  • https://help.sap.com/learning-journeys/5002d32d7a261014ad3081b2533c7414

  • https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/administración-de-núcleos-limpios-para-sap-s-4hana-cloud

You can also search for the exam code online — many users share answers that are quite accurate.

Focus on Asset Accounting, General Ledger (& Financial Closing), Dunning, and Clean Core — these are the most recurring topics in the certification.

If you have any other questions, feel free to reach out to me!

Best regards, and good luck with your certification.

entry.title: Re: Which API should be used to create an Invoice and als...
entry.content:
Hello!

If you need to create the invoice and make sure Trading Partner (VBUND) is filled, it depends on the invoice type:

FI invoice (FB70-type) → Use the Journal Entry – Post (Synchronous) API. You can pass VBUND directly in the line item, or let it derive from the business partner master data, as long as it’s maintained there and the document type is set up accordingly.

SD invoice (VF01) → Creation is only available via SOAP service (Billing Document – Create or Billing Document Request – Create). Once SD posts the FI document, VBUND will be derived from master data/config as usual. If you just need to read it, you can use the OData API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV.

Note: the Billing OData service is for read, cancel, and PDF only — it doesn’t create invoices.

entry.title: Re: Finding Odata Service(s) for a Fiori aap
entry.content:
Hello @Ashali 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, the OData service for a Fiori app is only listed in the SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library if it is a released service for external use. If the OData Service(s) field is blank, as in the case of Display Material Cost Estimates, it usually indicates below.

  • The app uses an analytical engine protocol or internal/private CDS views, not an exposed OData service.
  • The backend service exists but is not whitelisted for integration in the Public Cloud.

How can you check on your tenant?

  • Open the app → User Menu → About / App Information → check Technical Details for any OData service name.
  • Use the App Support app to see if any service or CDS view is linked.
  • In browser developer tools, look for metadata calls (for reference only, not supported for external use).

Official alternatives in Public Cloud,

  • Use released APIs from SAP API Business Hub, search for Product Costing or Cost Estimate APIs.
  • Use released analytical queries via View Browser, then expose them through the OData for Analytics endpoint.
  • Export data using the app’s built-in export functions.

In the Public Cloud, SAP recommends only using whitelisted APIs and released queries for integrations. Direct consumption of internal OData services is not supported.

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, only released APIs and CDS views are supported for consumption in external integrations.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Maintenance Timelines for SAP ERP HCM: What You Need to Know
entry.content:
This blog aims to inform you about the SAP ERP 6.0 maintenance timelines which SAP announced in 2020 and how they apply to your SAP ERP HCM (Human Capital Management) solution. We'll guide you through identifying your release and enhancement package level and outline your options to remain within maintenance.

When Will Maintenance for SAP ERP HCM End?

As outlined in the SAP Release and Maintenance Strategy (login required) and detailed in SAP Note 2881788 (login required) and the Product Availability Matrix (PAM), mainstream maintenance for the latest three enhancement packages for SAP ERP 6.0 – specifically enhancement packages 6, 7, and 8 – runs until December 31, 2027. This is followed by an optional extended maintenance phase lasting until December 31, 2030, which carries an additional cost.

However, it is crucial to note that mainstream maintenance for SAP ERP HCM 6.0 without any enhancement package, as well as SAP ERP HCM 6.0 with enhancement packages 1 to 5, will conclude on December 31, 2025.

How to Find Your Release and Enhancement Package Level

To determine your system's release and enhancement package level, follow these steps:

1. Log on to your system and open the system status:

This can typically be accessed from the main menu or administration settings.

2. Open the product version details:

Look for detailed information about the installed software versions.

3. Locate the entry for SAP_HR and note the release number next to it:

For any SAP ERP 6.0 system, the first digit will be 6. The second digit is not relevant for this check, and the third digit indicates your enhancement package level. For instance, 604 means the system is on SAP ERP 6.0 with enhancement package 4.

What Are Your Options to Stay in Maintenance?

It is important to start planning now, especially if you are using a system with maintenance ending in 2025, as transition projects can take months or even years.

SAP S/4HANA: With SAP's maintenance commitment extending until 2040 and over 20,000 customers already on board, SAP S/4HANA is the natural destination for a short-term technical transition. Many organizations also opt to move to the cloud, choosing RISE with SAP. Reach out to your SAP account executive or SAP partner to explore your options, including opportunities to modernize and transform to SAP SuccessFactors.

SAP Readiness Check: Before making any moves, we strongly recommend starting with the SAP Readiness Check. These tools are included with your maintenance agreement at no extra cost, providing a comprehensive overview of the most important aspects for a transition to SAP S/4HANA. While primarily designed for customers considering a system conversion (a technical transition of an entire SAP ERP system to SAP S/4HANA), SAP Readiness Checks also offer valuable insights for those planning a new implementation.  There are two Readiness Check variants that will support HCM transition. 

First is the SAP Readiness Check for S/4HANA Conversion.  This Readiness Check will provide you with insight into the Simplification Items required for HCM.  Additionally, the SAP Readiness Check for SAP SuccessFactors will provide more extensive insight into which components of the HCM solution are deployed, to what extent it has been customized, and a summary of integrations.  If you are running S/4HANA and HCM in the same landscape, these two Readiness Checks can be run together, for a consolidated view. 

Call to Action

Don’t miss out on these critical steps to ensure your system remains supported:

  1. Review your system to determine product release and associated end of maintenance date per the process outlined above.
  2. Run the SAP Readiness Checks to understand the scope and requirements for your transition.
  3. Explore the HCM EvoKit by registering on the appropriate page.
  4. Share your thoughts and feedback in the comments section below.

By acting now, you can ensure a smooth transition and continued support for your SAP ERP HCM solution.

entry.title: Forms Service by Adobe (SAP Cloud Platform Enterprise) - Usage vs Billing
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

Writing this blog to get the user community opinion on SAP Cloud Platform Enterprise Agreement "Usage" and "Billing". If my concern is valid then please help raise it with your account executive to get the SAP billing process fixed.

As per my understanding this will only impact customers whose Cloud Agreement does not start at the beginning of the month.

My scenario - Enterprise Cloud Agreement Jan 12, XXXX - Jan 11, (XXXX + 1). And we only use "Forms Service by Adobe" and we have purchased enough credits to support 2M form requests per contract year.


Cost breakdown by month and contract year.

Contract Year

(CY) #

Year

Month

 Opening Balance 

 Monthly Cost 

Usage

Credit at end of the month/ contract 

Comment

CY 1

2024

December

 15,232.00

98.00

6.6K

15,134.00

 Starting the table in Dec 2024 as the issue occurs in Jan 2025.

CY 1

2024

January

15,134.00

5,726.03

1.7M

9,407.97

Usage is 1.7 M, but cost is 5,726 for the period. Usage is based on contract year. But cost is equally distributed over the whole month, which crosses two contract years. Due to which CY1 has less cost based on total number of days in the CY1 for that month. And because of that the credit of 9407.97 is lost.

CY 2

2025

January

 18,036.00

10,410.97

58.2K

7,625.03

Usage is 58.2K but cost is 10,410 for the period. It costs more for 58.2K because cost is equally distributed over the whole month, which crosses two contract years.  Jan 1 – 11 which are in contract year 1 had 1.7 M request that cost is getting incurred in CY2. And because of that CY2 credits are used for CY1 usage and CY1 credits are getting lost.

CY 2

2025

February

7,625.03

504.00

41.5K

7,121.03

 

 

In the table above Jan is the month where contract 1 ends on Jan 11 and contract 2 starts on Jan 12. On Jan 10, 2025, we did performance testing as we had faced few issues while deploying the Forms Service by Adobe. Even though the usage was in contract year 1 and contract year 1 had enough credit $ remaining the billing was spread across two contract years, and cost was equally distributed for the whole month without respecting that contract period and $ credits. Due to which we lost the contract year 1 credit of 9.4K and ended up using 10.4K from the current contract year 2 for the usage of contract year 1.

Based on the above it is obvious when the contract does not begin on the first of the month then SAP billing results in overcharging the customer for cloud usage for that specific month. This issue is only for those customers whose SAP Cloud Platform Enterprise Agreement does not start on the first day of the month and had a major spike at the end of the previous contract period.

What is so frustrating is that we requested credit for 9.4K and SAP’s response was that their billing system has no issues. We requested to change the contract from Jan 12 to Jan 1 that way it does not occur in future, but we are facing pushbacks on that change.

Question:

  1. Do you think the billing process needs to be reviewed that way customer does not lose credits and get charged for previous contract year in the next contract year?
  2. Is my request for the credit and change to contract date reasonable?

entry.title: Re: To integrate s4hana public cloud with sap PaPM system
entry.content:
Hello @897654208074 ,

For this integration, yes, you will need to follow the procedure below;

Communication User – For authentication.

  • Go to Communication Management → Communication Users in SAP S/4HANA, Public Cloud.
  • Create a new user and set the password (store it securely).

Communication System – To specify the technical identity of the external system.

  • Go to Communication Systems.
  • Create a system with a meaningful ID for example BTP_INTEGRATION_SYS and the hostname of your target BTP endpoint.
  • Assign the Communication User created in step 1.

Communication Arrangement – To activate the correct API/service scenario.

  • SAP_COM_0276 – Generic OData API integration
  • SAP_COM_0008 – Business Partner
  • SAP_COM_0109 – Sales Order
    (Refer to the SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library to confirm the correct scenario for your case.)
  • Assign the Communication System and review the generated service URLs.

Destination in SAP BTP – To connect BTP to S/4HANA Cloud.

In the BTP Cockpit, create a new HTTP destination:

  • URL: Service URL from the Communication Arrangement
  • Proxy Type: Internet
  • Authentication: BasicAuthentication
  • User/Password: Communication User credentials

Optional: Add properties like sap-client or HTML5.DynamicDestination=true if needed for HTML5 apps.

Process overview:
1 → Create Communication User
2 → Create Communication System
3 → Create Communication Arrangement (matching the API)
4 → Create Destination in BTP (pointing to the service URL)

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: 🔴 Clean Core, Event-Driven: Unlocking SAP Value with Advanced Event Mesh
entry.content:
"Clean core is the foundation of modern SAP implementations—but achieving it while maintaining seamless integration across your enterprise landscape is one of the biggest challenges developers face today.

In this session, you’ll learn how SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh (AEM) empowers developers to overcome these hurdles and unlock greater value from both SAP and non-SAP systems.

We’ll explore how to rethink business processes as events. You’ll see how AEM helps you liberate data from silos, stream it across systems, filter for what matters, and react in real time—while enabling secure, democratized access across your organization.

We’ll also introduce the concept of micro integrations—a practical architectural pattern that simplifies complex system interactions and promotes agility, all while supporting a cleaner core.

Through a hands-on demo, we’ll showcase multiple micro integration scenarios, including one using the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) plugin, illustrating how to build responsive, decoupled SAP solutions.

Whether you're extending SAP, integrating services, or driving agility with SAP BTP, this session will give you the tools and perspective to evolve your integration strategy—without compromising the core."

entry.title: Re: Can the Forward Automation Settings be turned off or...
entry.content:
Hello @Noni 

In SAP S/4HANA Public cloud Edition, you can’t adjust STMS settings yourself. SAP manages all transport routes and configuration. You handle transports via Fiori apps like Export Customising Transports or Import Collection, but any backend STMS change requires raising an SAP support incident through SAP for Me.

Processing Transports in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition-SAP Learning 

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Public Cloud Payment medium file - Hash total calcula...
entry.content:
Hello @Sandhya_Reddy1 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the supplied Payment Medium Formats and the mapping logic in the Manage Payment Medium Formats app do not permit the direct embedding of multistep custom hash algorithms for .txt outputs, especially when they involve multi-field calculations like in your 3-step example.

You have a few possible approaches:

Pre/Post-Processing with Payment Medium Workbench (PMW)

  • If your format is PMW-based, you can use mapping logic extensions via Custom Fields and Logic (BAdI FINS_PMT_MEDIUM_MAP).
  • However, for .txt output, PMW still generates the file in the standard sequence, you need to include your calculated hash as part of a footer or trailer record.

SAP Help – configure Payment Medium Formats
SAP Help – BAdI for Payment Medium Mapping

Side-by-Side Calculation in BTP

  • Send the payment data to SAP Business Technology Platform via an API (API_PAYMENTADVICE_SRV or API_OUTBOUND_PAYMENTS_SRV), perform the hash total logic in a small Node.js/Java service, and output the .txt file in the exact format the bank needs.
  • This gives full control over calculations but keeps the Public Cloud core clean.


SAP API Business Hub – Outbound Payments API

Use Advanced Payment Management (if licensed)

  • If your landscape includes SAP Advanced Payment Management on BTP, you can establish file creation logic with custom calculations prior to generating the bank file.

In brief,

  • Public Cloud itself cannot incorporate this kind of multi-step hashing logic directly for .txt formats through standard configuration.
  • The most practical options are BAdI-based mapping logic in PMW or side-by-side processing in BTP.
  • The blog you found applies to .xml naming/hash rules and doesn’t cover .txt line-hash scenarios.

If you would like, I can prepare a BAdI sample implementation that performs your exact 3-step calculation so you can integrate it into the Payment Medium Mapping for .txt formats.

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: manage purchase order workflow in inapproval status
entry.content:
Hello @jerrysam 

The status displayed in the Manage Purchase Orders Fiori app is the definitive status for subsequent activities like Goods Receipt (GR).

If the PO still shows In Approval in this app, GR posting will be blocked even if other views appear to show released. This usually happens when the Flexible Workflow encounters an error or is interrupted during processing.

Steps to resolve it,

  • Open the Workflows in the Status Error app (requires the administrator role SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR or equivalent).
  • Locate the affected PO and select Resume After Error.
    • This continues the approval without restarting the workflow.
  • Check the Manage Purchase Orders app to confirm the status is now released.
  • Once the status is updated, you can post the GR.
  • If the status does not change or the PO does not appear in Workflows in Status Error, please raise an SAP support ticket under component MM-FIO-PUR-PO-WFL.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: 🔴 Hands-on session: practical demonstration of the Event Add-on for ERP
entry.content: In this session, we will demonstrate how to configure events in the Event Add-on for ERP and send them to SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh. You will learn how the add-on reacts to changes in the SAP system, turns them into events, and then seamlessly integrates with the broker, while benefiting from advanced features like Dynamic Topics and Async API specifications for Event Portal.

entry.title: 🔴 Seamless side-by-side extensibility with SAP Build and SAP Cloud Application Event Hub
entry.content:
An example on how to realize SAP’s strategy for clean core through side-by-side extensibility with SAP Build.
This session will provide an overview of the relevant capabilities from SAP Build, north star architecture and do a deep dive into how it is realized using SAP Cloud Application Event Hub. SAP Build already leverages this integration into supporting seamless integration with SuccessFactors and S/4 HANA. The presenters will go through how the journey looks from an end user and from an application provider’s perspectives. Details such as overall architecture and technical prerequisites will also be covered, including combining all the relevant pieces into a “how-to” integrate guide.

entry.title: Re: SEN: Tags for email notifications to users
entry.content:
Hi Charlene,

There are two ways to send messages to Enable Now users.

1. In the Manager > Server Settings area there is a Notifications and Email section of settings that provides the ability to send message to content authors and administrators when specific activities are triggered, e.g. to send a message to an author to trigger an update to that object.  The Activation setting in this area can be used to send messages to new end users to inform them their manual user account has been created.  So, this option will not help with your requirement

2. The second option is to use the messaging system in Manager to send messages to end users - Administration > Messages.  In this case, it is possible to use this functionality to send formatted messages to end users.  There is no way to embed placeholders into the Body of the message, e.g. to insert content such as a Course Title, but the content in the message can be formatted using HTML tags. 
The To field of the message will allow you to target specific users for your message, typically using a User Role or Org Unit value.

This is definitely your best option to target Enable Now user groups with email messages.

Regards
Shane

entry.title: Re: How to integrate SAP GRDC with Datasphere for public...
entry.content:
Hello @897654208074 

You can integrate SAP Group Reporting Data Collection (GRDC) with SAP Datasphere using the OData APIs that GRDC provides.

High-level steps below.

  • Find the right GRDC API in SAP API Business Hub (e.g., API_CNSLDTNGRPJRNLENTRT for consolidation journal entries).
  • Create a Communication User, System, and Arrangement in S/4HANA Cloud for that API (e.g., scenario SAP_COM_0524).
  • In SAP Datasphere, create a connection to S/4HANA Cloud using the API host and Basic Authentication from your Communication User.
  • Browse and import the OData entities into Datasphere as Remote Tables.
  • Model and consume the data for reporting.

Check below documentation

  • SAP Help – Connect SAP Datasphere to S/4HANA Cloud
  • Learning HUB
  • SAP Help – Group Reporting Data Collection Overview

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: 🔴 Using Intermediate Message Events and Success Factors Events in SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content:
Join us for an immersive session that explores the power of event-driven and API-based automation using SAP Build Process Automation. In today’s connected enterprise, automation needs to be responsive, scalable, and tightly integrated with core systems like S/4HANA and SuccessFactors. This session offers a deep dive into the key enablers that make that possible.

We’ll begin with an overview of API triggers, showcasing how external systems can initiate workflows through exposed APIs. Then, we’ll uncover the power of Intermediate Message Events (IMEs)—an essential tool for designing asynchronous, API-driven processes.

You'll also gain insights into setting up the Unified Connectivity Layer (UCL) and Event Broker, forming the backbone for scalable event handling in SAP Build.

Through live demos, you’ll witness two real-world scenarios:
🔹 Sales Order integration with S/4HANA, demonstrating how APIs and IMEs work together
🔹 SuccessFactors onboarding event trigger, where events initiate workflow via the Event Broker setup

Whether you're a developer, architect, or business process expert, this session will equip you with the knowledge to build intelligent, integrated, and event-aware automations.

entry.title: 🔴 A(P)I: Unified connectivity for AI applications using MCP
entry.content: This session will demonstrate how to connect AI-powered applications to external data sources, facilitating real-time AI-to-data integrations using a standardized mechanism based on the Model Context Protocol (MCP). We will explore key concepts of MCP, then put theory into practice with hands-on examples. Beyond exploring opportunities, applications and scenarios this technology enables, the session will also discuss typical operational challenges and security threats encountered when deploying and using MCP servers.

entry.title: Re: Process for migrating in learning history
entry.content:
Hello Sarah,

Please find below some discussion I could think of in terms of migration process for learning-related records.

Learning History
We normally recommend customers migrate their learning history from legacy to SF LMS where it will make sense after go-live. By "make sense", it can be part of the onboarding, compliance, or legal required courses, or it can be driving retraining. The rest of history can be maintained offline with the learning admin, or available online through SharePoint/Drive etc, and attach the link somewhere in SF / LMS so that it is accessible by the users. The reason for bringing in data that "makes sense" is that, as you mentioned, these learning history records need to be held against an item. So more history = more items to be migrated, and more values to be populated in the "reference" template.

Learning Items
In terms of learning items, we general do not recommend segregating the legacy items vs items to be used after golive, as it may confuse users. But if for reporting purposes, each single version of the items need to be tracked and reported on, then legacy items with versions will need to be imported with a shell, to host the learning history.

Otherwise the ideal scenario will be only migrate items that will be utilised after golive, and migrate the history for these items. Then no substitution relationship needs to be maintained as part of the data migration process. Given the history will be mapped directly against these items.

Completion Status for Migration?
We generally do not do anything special for migration, including completion statuses. As these statuses will not be used after golive, and it will be sort of redundant and just for one purpose. Customer's learning admins I worked with have never asked for another completion status, as the completion date and time was enough to tell. However, we do maintain substitution completion status just in case customers will use this function in the future.

Summing up we suggest customers to plan things around what is needed post go-live, and minimise the migration data where possible. But the process would change based on specific customer requirements, including notifications, assignments etc. Please feel free to post any further questions if the above does not suffice.

Thanks,
Sunny

entry.title: Re: Call an OData Web API Service externally
entry.content:
Thanks everone, based on input from everyone here, I have written the python code which connects to BTP and get the data from OData Web API. Here are the information, please note I made subtle changes to protect privacy, so URL and secrets are not going to work.

 

Data in your .env file:

SAP_TOKEN_URL =  

https://66a8b6c0trial.authentication.us10.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token [note there is no -web part]
 
SAP_ODATA_URL=https://7ab63f61-d9a7-4bdf-9057-beead39881c1.abap.us10.hana.ondemand.com/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZAPI_FLIGHT_WS_V2
SAP_USERNAME=[User Id you use to login to BTP Cockpit]
SAP_PASSWORD=[this is password you used to long into BTP Cockpit]
SAP_CLIENT_ID=sb-e773505a-dacd-3345-a599-3f65e3af3ccb!b484036|abap-trial-service-broker!b3132
SAP_CLIENT_SECRET=7ab91380-1422-4677-b5c7-437465cca37f$mOFnxea8Gvos2v03I2SBKZWqgHy2Q5K2hp6QnRrtGq8=
SAP_SCOPE= 
 
 
 
import requests
import json
import os
from dotenv import load_dotenv
from pathlib import Path

# Load environment variables from a .env file
env_path = Path('.') / '.env'  # Adjust path if needed
load_dotenv(dotenv_path=env_path)

# Debug: Print environment variables to verify they are loaded
print("SAP_TOKEN_URL:", os.getenv("SAP_TOKEN_URL"))
print("SAP_CLIENT_ID:", os.getenv("SAP_CLIENT_ID"))
print("SAP_CLIENT_SECRET:", os.getenv("SAP_CLIENT_SECRET"))
print("SAP_SCOPE:", os.getenv("SAP_SCOPE"))
print("SAP_USERNAME:", os.getenv("SAP_USERNAME"))  # For Password Credentials
print("SAP_PASSWORD:", "****" if os.getenv("SAP_PASSWORD") else None)  # Masked for security

def fetch_sap_odata():
    token_url = os.getenv("SAP_TOKEN_URL")
    client_id = os.getenv("SAP_CLIENT_ID")
    client_secret = os.getenv("SAP_CLIENT_SECRET")
    scope = os.getenv("SAP_SCOPE")
    username = os.getenv("SAP_USERNAME")
    password = os.getenv("SAP_PASSWORD")

    # Check if required environment variables are set
    if not all([token_url, client_id, client_secret, username, password]):
        raise ValueError("Missing required environment variables: SAP_TOKEN_URL, SAP_CLIENT_ID, SAP_CLIENT_SECRET, SAP_USERNAME, or SAP_PASSWORD")

    # Step 1: Fetch OAuth token
    url = token_url
    data = {
        "grant_type": "password",
        "username": username,
        "password": password,
        "client_id": client_id,
        "client_secret": client_secret
    }
    
    if scope:
        data["scope"] = scope

    headers = {
        "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
    }
    
    try:
        session = requests.Session()
        response = session.post(url, data=data, headers=headers)
        response.raise_for_status()
        token_data = response.json()
        access_token = token_data.get("access_token")
        if not access_token:
            raise ValueError("No access token received from token endpoint")
        print("Token response:", token_data)
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        print(f"Error fetching token: {e}")
        return

    # Step 2: OData API call to ZI_Connection_WS
    odata_base_url = os.getenv("SAP_ODATA_URL")
    if not odata_base_url:
        raise ValueError("Missing SAP_ODATA_URL environment variable")
    
    odata_url = f"{odata_base_url}/ZI_Connection_WS"
    headers = {
        "Authorization": f"Bearer {access_token}",
        "Accept": "application/json",
        "Content-Type": "application/json"
    }

    try:
        response = requests.get(odata_url, headers=headers)
        print("Code:", response.status_code)
        print("Server response:", response.text)

        if response.status_code == 200:
            try:
                print("ZI_Connection_WS data:", json.dumps(response.json(), indent=2))
            except requests.exceptions.JSONDecodeError:
                print("❌ Error: No JSON response.")
        else:
            print("❌ Error response:", response.status_code, response.text)
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        print(f"Error fetching ZI_Connection_WS data: {e}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    fetch_sap_odata()

entry.title: Elevate Your SAP CX Skills at SAP Connect Las Vegas - join Pre-Conference Trainings (Oct 6th' 2025)
entry.content:
Prepare for an exhilarating SAP Connect event in Las Vegas from October 6–8. This year, we're starting with something impactful: exclusive pre-conference training sessions crafted to elevate your skills, accelerate your learning, and give you a head start on the competition before the main conference begins. We offer specialized sessions in SAP Customer Experience AI Features, SAP Commerce Cloud, and SAP Sales Cloud.

No matter your role—developer, analyst, consultant, or business leader—these expert-led, hands-on sessions are the ideal way to launch your SAP Connect journey with confidence and purpose.

Why Attend the Pre-Conference Trainings?

  • Deep-Dive Learning: Delve beyond the basics with in-depth, real-world training conducted by SAP experts.
  • Early Networking: Connect with peers and SAP professionals in a more focused, collaborative setting.
  • Boost Your ROI: Acquire actionable skills and insights to optimize your experience at the main conference.

Session Details:

CXPC01 - Supercharge Your SAP CX Expertise with AI
Explore the transformative impact of artificial intelligence on customer experience in this interactive session. Step beyond the buzzwords and engage with the latest AI use cases in SAP Customer Experience. We’ll dive into Predictive AI, Generative AI, and Conversational AI and their roles in reshaping business operations. Benefit from real-world examples, ask questions, share your views, and get inspired. Live demonstrations will showcase AI in action across SAP Commerce Cloud, SAP Sales Cloud Version 2, SAP Service Cloud Version 2, and the SAP CX AI Toolkit. Hands-on exercises will guide you in solving business challenges using cutting-edge AI tools within SAP CX.

  • Intended Audience: Business professionals, SAP users, and IT specialists
  • Level: Intermediate | Advanced
  • Date and Time: Monday, October 6th, 2025 | 12:30 PM - 4:00 PM (PST)
  • Instructor: Fernando Redondo

CXPC02 - SAP Commerce Cloud for B2B: Unlocking Business-to-Business Capabilities
Uncover the advanced B2B functionalities within SAP Commerce Cloud in this session. Learn to manage B2B users and organizational hierarchies while exploring specialized e-commerce features tailored for business clientele. Perfect for those looking to optimize B2B operations, this course offers valuable insights into streamlining complex structures and workflows via the SAP Commerce Cloud platform.

  • Intended Audience: Business users, analysts, consultants, and end users of SAP Commerce Cloud
  • Level: Beginner | Intermediate
  • Date and Time: Monday, October 6th, 2025 | 8:00 AM - 11:30 AM (PST)
  • Instructor: Cui Jian

CXPC03 - Mastering Sales Excellence with SAP Sales Cloud Version 2: A Consultant's Guide
Dive into the new SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 solution in this comprehensive session. We’ll explore its positioning, implementation, and key scenarios like pipeline management, guided selling, forecasting, and enhancing sales processes with AI. Designed for consultants eager to grasp the solution's configurations, this workshop combines discussions, demonstrations, and exercises to solidify your understanding.

  • Target Audience: All business users
  • Level: Beginner | Intermediate
  • Date and Time: Monday, October 6th, 2025 | 12:30 PM - 4:00 PM (PST)
  • Instructor: Deepali Johnson

entry.title: MT940 files requires selecting both a specific company and bank account
entry.content:
Dear SAP,

We want to know the functionality of MT940

In SAP Business ByDesign, the current manual import process for MT940 files requires selecting both a specific company and bank account, which implies that the MT940 files must be separated by account prior to upload.

At present, our customers are receiving consolidated MT940 files that include transactions from multiple bank accounts. We would like to know if it is possible to upload such multi-account MT940 files without having to specify the company and bank account during the upload process.

Please let me know if there is option available for above requirement.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: MT940 files requires selecting both a specific compan...
entry.content:
Dear Customer, 

When importing MT940 files in Liquidity Management > File Management > Inbound Files, it is necessary to select both:

  • Company

  • Bank ID (House Bank)

A Bank ID in ByDesign can represent a house bank that may contain one or more individual bank accounts. However, the MT940 format also includes an account identification field (tag :25:), and the system expects the transactions in the uploaded file to match the specific account linked to the Bank ID selection.

Even if a Bank ID contains multiple accounts, the file uploaded must contain transactions for only one account. The system will not automatically detect and split transactions for different accounts within the same Bank ID.

At present, splitting the file before upload remains the only available option to ensure correct assignment of transactions in SAP Business ByDesign.

 

Hope this clarify your question. 

 

Best regards,  
Ihan
SAP Technical Support

entry.title: Managing Exceptions in Sales Material Exclusions in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Scenario: As a Sales Representative, you want to ensure that certain products cannot be sold to specific customers. These customers belong to a customer hierarchy. However, there may be exceptions where a specific customer within the hierarchy is allowed to purchase the product.

Example: All customers under the hierarchy node North cannot purchase the product TG11. However, the customer DEMO_C02, under the same node, is allowed to purchase TG11.

Configuration steps

1. Create Condition Types:

Create a new condition type Z002 for the "excluded list" using the pre-delivered access sequence A001.

Create another condition type Z003 using the pre-delivered customer hierarchy access sequence A003.

2. Implement Cloud BADI:

Create a Cloud BADI implementation YY1_EXCLUDELIST with the extension ID SD_LSTG_EXCLSN_RQMT_DOC_ITEM in the App ‘Customer Logic’.

Write logic to ensure that records maintained in condition type Z002 can override the exclusion records. Condition records for listing exclusion can be retrieved via released CDS view I_SlsMatlLstgOrExclsnRecord.

3. Create a requirement 3000000 with the task SD_LSTG_EXCLSN_RQMT_DOC_ITEM. Assign the Cloud BAdI implementation YY1_EXCLUDELIST to this requirement.

4. Assign the requirement 3000000 to the listing/exclusion procedure Z003.

5. Assign the procedure Z003 to the exclusion process for sales orders (e.g., OR).

6. Use the App ‘Create Material Listings and Exclusions’ to create new records:

Excluded list for specific customers.

Records for customer hierarchy.

Test the Configuration:

Scenario 1:

Create a sales order with the customer DEMO_C01 and material TG11.

Result: Product TG11 is excluded for customer DEMO_C01 because this customer belongs to the North hierarchy node, which excludes TG11.

Scenario 2:

Create a sales order with the customer DEMO_C02 and material TG11.

Result: Product TG11 is allowed for customer DEMO_C02 because it matches the "Exclude list" condition in condition type Z002, even though it also belongs to the North hierarchy node.

entry.title: Re: Date Comparision in Build Process Automation Decision...
entry.content:
Hi， you need to create custom script in your automation, convert your date to Date object, and then compare the Dates, for example:

const date1 = new Date('2023-10-01');
const date2 = new Date('2023-10-05');

if (date1 < date2) {
    console.log('date1 is earlier than date2');
} else if (date1 > date2) {
    console.log('date1 is later than date2');
} else {
    console.log('date1 is the same as date2');
}

entry.title: Re: SEN: Tags for email notifications to users
entry.content:
Hi Charlene,

SAP Companion contains 4 different tabs of information, the What's New tab is one of the four.  The reason that I mention that tab is because it proactively notifies users of new content.  But, it will not distinguish between users groups.

One of the other tabs in SAP Companion, the Learning tab, provides access to Enable Now content, such as new courseware and Simulations.  It is possible to control what content appears in that tab based on Business Roles, which can be used to target a group of users with a specific block of content.  Unfortunately, the content in the Learning tab does not proactively notify users of the existence of the content, users must open the Learning tab on the relevant screen to access the content.

So, given that proactive notification is central to your strategy to drive engagement, your options are:

1. The Messages screen in Manager - you can target specific user groups with these messages
2. The What's New tab in SAP Companion - you cannot target specific user groups with this information, if a user opens the relevant screen in the application they will receive the message
3. One of the other methods of auto showing content using SAP Companion, e.g. auto starting Link Tiles - you cannot target specific user groups with these messages.

Hope that helps.

Regards
Shane

entry.title: Re: FI Doc Types Authorization Group: Examples
entry.content:
An Authorization Group is a way to restrict access to specific objects—like tables, programs, vendors, or document types—based on user roles. It works in tandem with authorization objects (like S_TABU_DIS for tables or F_LFA1_BEK for vendors).

Think of it like a security tag: only users with the right clearance (via roles) can access objects tagged with a specific authorization group.

An example use case be let’s say you’re creating a new document type for confidential purchase orders (e.g., for strategic sourcing). You assign it an Authorization Group called ZSTR. What happens next is only users whose roles include access to ZSTR (via the relevant authorization object) can view or process these POs. Even if someone has general access to purchase orders, they won’t be able to access those tagged with ZSTR unless their role explicitly allows it. This is especially useful for:

  • Securing sensitive vendor data
  • Restricting access to financial documents
  • Controlling who can run or modify custom reports/programs

To answer your question 'Do we need to provide these values to Developers?', yes if the developer is creating or modifying programs, reports, or custom logic that should be protected by the same authorization group, you should share the value (e.g., ZSTR) with them. Why because, Developers may need to assign the same group to custom programs via SE38. They might need to check for authorization using ABAP logic (AUTHORITY-CHECK). It ensures consistency across all objects tied to that document type.

To create an Authorization Group, go to SE54 and assign groups to tables or views. Use SM30 to maintain entries in table TBRG (central repository of auth groups). Assign the group to the relevant object (e.g., vendor via FK02, customer via XD02, program via SE38).

entry.title: Re: Refurbishment Process
entry.content:
While there is no single scope item named “Refurbishment,” the process is supported through a combination of standard scope items

You can explore these scope items in the SAP Best Practices Explorer or via the SAP Signavio Process Navigator.

entry.title: Re: How to define the Revenue attribute in the WBS elemen...
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the traditional method of assigning the Revenue attribute to a WBS element—such as using transaction code CJ02—is not applicable, since GUI-based configuration access is restricted in the public cloud environment. Instead, revenue-related WBS elements are managed through predefined apps and configuration settings.

Key Differences from On-Premise

  • No access to CJ02 or CJ20N: These GUI transactions are not available.
  • Billing elements are not manually selectable in WBS details.
  • Revenue WBS elements are typically automatically created based on project structure and billing setup.

The recommended approach would be

In the Professional Services scenario, WBS elements ending in .0.1 are automatically created as billing elements. These are superior to expense WBS elements like .1.1, .1.2, etc. Revenue is posted to the billing WBS element when customer billing occurs.

To ensure revenue tracking, create separate billing items for each work package. This aligns the expense WBS with the billing WBS in a 1:1 relationship. Use the CDS view I_ENTERPRISEPROJECTELEMENT to verify hierarchy and attributes.

Also have a look at this discussion

entry.title: Re: tax jurisdiction has defective structure,
entry.content:
Some common causes are

Incorrect Structure Format

Each tax jurisdiction code must match the structure defined in the system. For example: Structure: 2,2,5,1 means the code should be split into four levels with lengths 2, 2, 5, and 1 respectively. If your code is VA00234560, it must conform to this format exactly.

Double-check the structure defined in your configuration and ensure all codes match it precisely.

Wrong SSCUI Used

In some cases, users mistakenly enter tax jurisdiction codes in the wrong configuration view. Use SSCUI 102915 – Define Tax Jurisdiction Codes instead of manually entering codes in views like V_TTXJ.

Pre-existing Codes Preventing Changes

If tax jurisdiction codes are already created, the system may prevent changes to the structure. You may need to delete and re-create the codes or raise a ticket with SAP support to adjust the structure safely.

Using Internal vs External Tax Procedures

If you're using internal tax procedures like USTAXJ, ensure the structure aligns with the expected format for your region (e.g., ZIP code level for U.S.).

entry.title: Re: Error ME708 when deleting memorized MIRO
entry.content:
SAP Note 2143933 provides a workaround to delete parked or pre-edited supplier invoices that cannot be posted or canceled via standard transactions like MIR4 or MR8M. The note includes a custom report: Z_MRM_DELETE_PP_1.
What this report is supposed to do is that it deletes parked supplier invoice documents that are stuck due to inconsistencies or obsolete prepayment flows. Updates the status from parked to deleted. Targets documents that cannot be processed due to errors like M8_2501 or ME708.

In your case, if it is not working, then, it could be due to

  • authorization restrictions, client-specific data locks, or missing transport of dependent objects.
  • the report may not have updated all relevant tables (e.g., RBKP, RSEG, EKBE) or failed due to missing commit logic.
  • if M8_2501 still appears, then, it indicates that the invoice is still considered active or linked to a PO item that has already been invoiced.

What you can try is again go to se38, run that report with Document number, Fiscal Year and Company Code. Ensure that the status message confirms deletion (not just simulation).
Check in tables like RBKP, RSEG, EKBE and confirm that the invoice document is no longer linked or marked as parked.
If a real invoice was posted against the same PO item, the parked invoice may be blocked from deletion. Use MIR4 to simulate posting and check for conflicts

Still if the issue is not resolved in production, raise a ticket with SAP referencing the above SAP Note 2143933

entry.title: Issue with a simple FMS
entry.content:
Hi All,

I've created a udf: Tariff (Type Percents) and i want the fms to calculate Unitprice*U_Tariff/100.

FMS created: 

SELECT  $[RDR1.PriceBefDi.NUMBER] * $[RDR1.U_Tariff.NUMBER]/100

I want this to calculated in a udf as soon as Tariff% is calculated but i get the below error:

1). [Microsoft][ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server][SQL Server]Incorrect syntax near '15.000000'.  --> (15 entered in Tariff UDF)
2). [Microsoft][ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server][SQL Server]Statement 'Shipping Types' (OSHP) (s) could not be prepared.--> Not sure where this is coming from..

Can someone please point out what's wrong with the fms and how to fix this?

Regards,

Joseph

entry.title: Re: Call an OData Web API Service externally
entry.content:
Code for CSRF for posting

import requests
import json
import os
from dotenv import load_dotenv
from pathlib import Path

# Load environment variables from a .env file
env_path = Path('.') / '.env'  # Adjust path if needed
load_dotenv(dotenv_path=env_path)

# Debug: Print environment variables to verify they are loaded
print("SAP_TOKEN_URL:", os.getenv("SAP_TOKEN_URL"))
print("SAP_CLIENT_ID:", os.getenv("SAP_CLIENT_ID"))
print("SAP_CLIENT_SECRET:", os.getenv("SAP_CLIENT_SECRET"))
print("SAP_SCOPE:", os.getenv("SAP_SCOPE"))
print("SAP_USERNAME:", os.getenv("SAP_USERNAME"))  # For Password Credentials
print("SAP_PASSWORD:", "****" if os.getenv("SAP_PASSWORD") else None)  # Masked for security

def fetch_sap_odata():
    token_url = os.getenv("SAP_TOKEN_URL")
    client_id = os.getenv("SAP_CLIENT_ID")
    client_secret = os.getenv("SAP_CLIENT_SECRET")
    scope = os.getenv("SAP_SCOPE")
    username = os.getenv("SAP_USERNAME")
    password = os.getenv("SAP_PASSWORD")

    # Check if required environment variables are set
    if not all([token_url, client_id, client_secret, username, password]):
        raise ValueError("Missing required environment variables: SAP_TOKEN_URL, SAP_CLIENT_ID, SAP_CLIENT_SECRET, SAP_USERNAME, or SAP_PASSWORD")

    # Step 1: Fetch OAuth token
    url = token_url
    data = {
        "grant_type": "password",
        "username": username,
        "password": password,
        "client_id": client_id,
        "client_secret": client_secret
    }
    
    if scope:
        data["scope"] = scope

    headers = {
        "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
    }
    
    try:
        session = requests.Session()
        response = session.post(url, data=data, headers=headers)
        response.raise_for_status()
        token_data = response.json()
        access_token = token_data.get("access_token")
        if not access_token:
            raise ValueError("No access token received from token endpoint")
        print("Token response:", token_data)
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        print(f"Error fetching token: {e}")
        return

    # Step 2: Fetch CSRF token
    odata_base_url = os.getenv("SAP_ODATA_URL")
    if not odata_base_url:
        raise ValueError("Missing SAP_ODATA_URL environment variable")
    
    odata_url_csrf = f"{odata_base_url}/ZI_Connection_WS"
    headers = {
        "Authorization": f"Bearer {access_token}",
        "X-CSRF-Token": "Fetch",
        "Accept": "application/json"
    }

    try:
        csrf_response = session.get(url=odata_url_csrf, headers=headers)
        csrf_response.raise_for_status()
        csrf_token = csrf_response.headers.get("X-CSRF-Token")
        if not csrf_token:
            print("Warning: No CSRF token found in response headers.")
        else:
            print("CSRF Token retrieved:", csrf_token)
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        print(f"Error fetching CSRF token: {e}")
        return

    # Step 3: OData API call to ZI_Connection_WS
    odata_url = f"{odata_base_url}/ZI_Connection_WS"
    headers = {
        "Authorization": f"Bearer {access_token}",
        "X-CSRF-Token": csrf_token if csrf_token else "",
        "Accept": "application/json",
        "Content-Type": "application/json"
    }

    try:
        response = session.get(odata_url, headers=headers)
        print("Code:", response.status_code)
        print("Server response:", response.text)

        if response.status_code == 200:
            try:
                print("ZI_Connection_WS data:", json.dumps(response.json(), indent=2))
            except requests.exceptions.JSONDecodeError:
                print("❌ Error: No JSON response.")
        else:
            print("❌ Error response:", response.status_code, response.text)

        # Example: Placeholder for a modifying request (e.g., POST)
        # if csrf_token:
        #     post_data = {"SomeField": "SomeValue"}  # Customize this data
        #     post_response = session.post(odata_url, headers=headers, json=post_data)
        #     print("POST Response Code:", post_response.status_code)
        #     print("POST Response:", post_response.text)
        #     if post_response.status_code == 201:  # 201 Created
        #         print("Data successfully posted.")
        #     else:
        #         print("❌ POST failed:", post_response.status_code, post_response.text)

    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        print(f"Error fetching ZI_Connection_WS data: {e}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    fetch_sap_odata()

entry.title: Re: Delivery address change causes a subsequent leg in sh...
entry.content:
SAP uses leg determination to break down a shipment into stages:

  • Preliminary leg: From shipping point to consolidation point
  • Main leg: From consolidation point to destination region
  • Subsequent leg: From destination region to final delivery point

Changing the Ship-To address can trigger a reclassification of the route, especially if:

  • the new address is in a different region or country
  • the system identifies a need for an additional transport stage

When the Ship-To address is modified, SAP recalculates the route and determines that the new address requires an additional leg. This is common when the new address is outside the original transportation zone

If the shipment type is configured to support multi-leg determination (leg indicator types 2, 3, 4, or 5), the system may automatically insert a subsequent leg to reflect the new logistics path

What you can do is Check leg determination settings in customizing (SPRO > Logistics Execution > Transportation > Shipment > Define Leg Determination). Review the route and transportation zone of the new Ship-To address. If the subsequent leg is not desired, consider adjusting:

  • Shipping conditions
  • Transportation zones
  • Leg determination rules
